image.altText: close up of sanjeev gupta in glasses

props.synopsis: Sanjeev Gupta is gone from the Whyalla steelworks but his troubles are far from over, with a former high-level international executive who oversaw the South Australian operation now suing for US $30 million in unpaid wages and bonuses.

title.children: Sanjeev Gupta accused of deliberately losing phones in unpaid wages court claim

image.altText: Garth and Max 2

props.synopsis: Despite assistance dog Max wearing a clearly visible vest and Garth Murray carrying his accreditation, they still face widespread discrimination, with one hotel going so far as to call the cops on them.

title.children: County pub calls the cops on army vet and his assistance dog

image.altText: Columns of building with branches

props.synopsis: A new push to change South Australia's abortion laws to limit terminations after 23 weeks has been voted down in state parliament's Upper House.

title.children: Abortion legislation voted down in South Australian Parliament

image.altText: People standing in a group wearing T-shirts that say "drink more, die younger".

props.synopsis: The Coonawarra Vignerons, in South Australia's South East, has deleted a post which attracted controversy for celebrating binge drinking.

title.children: Wine body sorry for 'disappointing' T-shirts bearing 'irresponsible' messaging

image.altText: A blonde jockey smiles as she holds a gleaming trophy aloft at a race track.

props.synopsis: History-making jockey Jamie Melham has hit the headlines for the wrong reasons, with the Melbourne Cup winner banned for 30 race meetings for careless riding that resulted in a race fall for Blake Shinn.

title.children: Melbourne Cup winner Jamie Melham banned over Blake Shinn race fall

image.altText: A person in shadow walks through a caged internal courtyard covered in more shadows.

props.synopsis: Children and young people at Adelaide's only youth detention centre are being held to the floor in a restraint technique that "may constitute a breach of human rights and clinical best practice", according to a report tabled in parliament.

title.children: Report reveals SA youth detainees 'routinely' physically restrained

image.altText: the tail of a Qantas Boeing 767

props.synopsis: Three Liberal politicians have been delayed getting to Canberra for climate talks after a Qantas plane was forced to make an urgent landing at Adelaide Airport when crews noticed smoke in the cabin.

title.children: Plane forced to turn back to Adelaide after smoke in cabin

image.altText: man in car with hand out a window with gold rings on and woman in pink and blue shirt sits in passenger seat

props.synopsis: For the past 25 years the "king of weeds", Mark Facer, has been chasing and eradicating weeds. Now he has been called in to help graziers in far west NSW with the worst mesquite infestation he has seen.

title.children: 'Pablo Escobar of weeds' called in to tackle tree infestation in the millions

image.altText: Sussan Ley speak to the media.

props.synopsis: The most authoritative snapshot of where the global energy transition is going has just been released at a most opportune moment for any politician weighing which direction Australia should pursue.

title.children: Liberals want to pause net zero but the IEA says it wins on cost

image.altText: A woman in a dark blazer sits in a room in front of a bannister and the window blinds are down

props.synopsis: Andrea Foster and her son Peter Spiniello continue to feel let down by a system they believe caused the death of their daughter, and sister, who was killed seven years ago by a mentally unwell man.

title.children: Family of woman killed by mentally unwell man says her death was 'preventable'

image.altText: An SA Police car drives on a city street.

props.synopsis: Police said a 25-year-old man was struck by a car on Hillier Road at Hillier just before 8pm on Tuesday.

title.children: 25yo man dies after alleged hit-run in Adelaide's north

image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: A Senate inquiry into South Australia's toxic algal bloom has been tabled highlighting "limitations" in how the government has handled the crisis.

title.children: Government preparedness for SA's algal bloom criticised in Senate report

image.altText: A woman holding a baby at the beach at sunset

props.synopsis: Meg Longstaff hoped to continue a family tradition of beach holidays this summer, but a council decision on fire safety enforcement means she and other unit owners may be forced to make other plans.

title.children: Holiday cabin owners kicked out after new council safety ruling

image.altText: Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu standing with their faces very close to each other behind a podium

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has taken the extraordinary step of writing to Israel's President Isaac Herzog calling on him to pardon Benjamin Netanyahu of long-standing corruption charges.

title.children: Trump writes formal letter to ask for a pardon for Netanyahu

image.altText: man in navy blue suit raises his hand as he speaks in ukrainian parliament

props.synopsis: After his suspension from the post of justice minister, German Galushchenko said in a Facebook post that he would defend himself in court.

title.children: Zelenskyy allies face dismissal over widening Ukraine corruption scandal

image.altText: Keir Starmer holding folios walking out of the Number 10 Downing Street front door.

props.synopsis: Sir Keir Starmer is denying he authorised unnamed allies to brief the media about a possible leadership challenge, in a move that forced his health minister to publicly deny he was plotting against him.

title.children: UK Prime Minister insists team 'united' amid leadership challenge rumours

image.altText: Thai military officers in green camouflage clothing standing with their arms raised on a dirt road in front of armoured vehicles

props.synopsis: Phnom Penh has accused Thai troops of killing a civilian at the border, just days after a peace deal between the two countries was paused by Thailand.

title.children: Cambodia and Thailand trade accusations of violence at border

image.altText: the outside of a house with building fencing around it

props.synopsis: Eleven flood buyback homes sell without a reserve price in the NSW Northern Rivers, with more to hit the market before the end of the year.

title.children: 'Surreal' experience as flood-affected homes sold for as little as $1

image.altText: Group of city workers walking on street

props.synopsis: The October unemployment rate is crucial because it will either cement the RBA's decision to keep interest rates on hold, or cause more confusion about monetary policy. Early evidence points to a weakening jobs market.

title.children: Millions of borrowers face anxious wait ahead of crucial official data

image.altText: A computer-generated image of the interior of a sports stadium.

props.synopsis: While Tasmania's MPs will pass the proposed AFL stadium through the lower house on Thursday, it's become a much tougher task ahead to win over the parliament's key upper house decision-makers.

title.children: Devils could die as government risks letting stadium slip ahead of crucial vote

image.altText: A woman and man lean on a wire fence on a rural property.

props.synopsis: Emmaly and David Gridley were shocked to learn their rural property had been mistakenly valued at $2.3 million, leaving them with a heavily inflated land tax bill.

title.children: Couple goes from potential windfall to large land tax bill, twice

image.altText: A man and a woman in broad brimmed hats stand in a paddock in front of a truck.

props.synopsis: Growers at Walgett are grinning from ear to ear as they fill their silos with a bumper grain harvest.

title.children: Grain growers reap rewards of bumper crop in 'perfect season'

image.altText: Bagpipers

props.synopsis: The biggest ever ensemble of bagpipers gathered in Melbourne's Fed Square to play tribute to AC/DC, smashing a world record.

title.children: Bagpipe world record broken in Melbourne

image.altText: A man in a white shirt is escorted by police officers with his hands behind his back

props.synopsis: The US has accused She Zhijiang of turning a village on the Thailand-Myanmar border into a resort city "custom built for gambling, drug trafficking, prostitution, and scams targeting people around the world".

title.children: Alleged scam kingpin extradited to China from Thailand

image.altText: Troy Cordingley and his daughter Toyah

props.synopsis: Toyah Cordingley's father has told a jury he paused to rest under a tree during the search for his daughter when he noticed an "odd-shaped mound" at his feet.

title.children: 'I just reeled backwards': Father tells court of moment he found daughter's body

image.altText: Eddie Murphy laughs while sitting on a chair in home, apparently being interviewed.

props.synopsis: Eddie Murphy has taken on many characters throughout his career, sometimes even within the same film. But a new documentary explores the "real Eddie Murphy" — someone the actor and comedian says few people actually know.

title.children: Eddie Murphy conquered Hollywood without ever revealing his true self

image.altText: A crowd of people walking along a street carrying shopping bags on an overcast day.

props.synopsis: A scathing Productivity Commission review concludes that Australia's mental health system is failing and needs a rewrite, while warning that 500,000 Australians are unable to access the care that they need.

title.children: Half a million Australians with psychosocial illness without support

image.altText: Prabowo and Albanese speak at a podium, both suits and "HMAS CANBERRA" hats.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese declares a "new era" in the relationship between the neighbours in a joint appearance with Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto in Sydney.

title.children: Australia and Indonesia strike landmark security treaty

image.altText: Linda wears black rimmed glasses and a blue blazer as she smiles

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds is suing the Commonwealth and its lawyers over the handling of Brittany Higgins' $2.4 million compensation settlement, yet has removed specific allegations against the former Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus.

title.children: With 'reputational vindication' already achieved, Reynolds targets 'financial vindication'

image.altText: A menulog closed sign is seen in the window of a restaurant

props.synopsis: Food delivery company Menulog says it will cease operating in Australia in two weeks' time, prompting questions about whether Australia can maintain a competitive food delivery market.

title.children: Menulog to cease Australian operations

image.altText: 2025-10-21T111320Z_2026951675_RC2ZCY92P5PC_RTRMADP_3_BRITAIN-ROYALS-ANDREW-SCANDAL

props.synopsis: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor has applied to close down some of his last remaining business interests, weeks after he was stripped of his titles and honours.

title.children: Former prince Andrew shuts down royal business venture

image.altText: England Test cricket captain Ben Stokes speaks to the media at training.

props.synopsis: Critics of England's truncated preparation for this summer's Ashes Test series are off the mark, according to touring captain Ben Stokes.

title.children: Stokes takes aim at 'has-beens' as England's Ashes prep criticised

image.altText: Photo illustration shows a downward trending line chart with emissions from a fossil fuel plant and a forest on either side.

props.synopsis: The Coalition is debating whether to dump its commitment to the net zero climate target. Here's what that term actually means.

title.children: Can we tackle global warming without net zero? Here's what it really means

image.altText: A man with a grey beard and black cap and a blonde woman resting her hand on his shoulder smile in a radio studio.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Office of Public Prosecutions says it will not lay contempt of court charges against the controversial radio hosts, who made comments about the Erin Patterson case in the middle of her trial.

title.children: 'Lock that b**** up': Kyle and Jackie O avoid charges over mushroom trial comments

image.altText: A sign out the front of a school

props.synopsis: Staff at Yipirinya School in Alice Springs say they will fight back after the school's statutory manager announced up to 20 redundancies amid plunging enrolments and a multi-million-dollar debt.

title.children: Staff at NT Indigenous school to fight back against 'shock' redundancies
